text: Mali at the Olympics is a history which started in the 1960s. Since 1962, Mali has contributed to the growth of the "Olympic Movement". Olympics.org, "Factsheet: The Olympic Movement"; retrieved 2012-7-28. The International Olympic Committee's official abbreviation for Mali is MLI. "Official abbreviations" at The Games of the XVIII Olympiad, Tokyo, 1964, [p. 9 of 409 PDF]; retrieved 2012-8-16. ==History== Mali has taken part in the Summer Olympic Games held in 1964, 1972, and every Olympics since 1980. The country has never won an Olympic medal. No athletes from Mali have been in any Winter Olympic Games. The National Olympic Committee for Mali was formed in 1962 and recognized by the International Olympic Committee in 1963. ==Related pages== * List of IOC country codes ==References== == Other websites == * Mali profile at London2012.com Category:Nations at the Olympics Category:Sport in Mali Category:National sports teams of Mali
title: Mali at the Olympics
